alert.note: Alert for Childress; Cochran; Hall; Hockley; Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 01 at 11:54PM CST until January 02 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 5 below zero. * WHERE...Cochran, Hockley, Lubbock, Childress and Hall Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Frostbite and hypothermia are possible if precautions are not taken. Wind chill values may fall to extremely dangerous levels. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Road conditions are still very bad and with the frigid temperatures, will not improve during the overnight hours. Travel should be discouraged.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Keep pets indoors as much as possible. Make frequent checks on older family, friends, and neighbors. Ensure portable heaters are used correctly. Do not use generators or grills inside.
